title: First Fleet (United Kingdom)
text:
The First Fleet was a <a href="formation%20%28military%29">formation</a> of the <a href="Royal%20Navy">Royal Navy</a> that briefly existed before the <a href="World%20War%20I">First World War</a> from 1912 to 1914.
History.
Formed on 31 July 1912 the <a href="Home%20Fleet">Commander-in-Chief Home Fleets</a> had direct command of the First Fleet; and a Vice Admiral commanded the Second and Third Fleets. All the numbered fleets during this period had different levels of battle readiness for example the first fleet ships were in full commission. The fleet also included, under Captain <a href="Cecil%20Lambert">Cecil Lambert</a>, four destroyer flotillas. Captain <a href="Reginald%20Tyrwhitt">Reginald Tyrwhitt</a> took over the command of the destroyer flotillas in December 1913.
